name: abdominal calcification in an infant or child
description: Calcified deposits in the abdominal region of a young patient.

name: abnormal position of the heart
description: The heart is situated in an unusual location within the thorax.

name: acute lung injury and ARDS in children
description: Injury to the lungs in children leading to acute respiratory distress.

name: acyanotic congenital heart disease with increased pulmonary vascularity
description: A heart defect present at birth without cyanosis but increased blood flow to the lungs.

name: acyanotic congenital heart disease with normal pulmonary vascularity
description: A congenital heart defect without cyanosis and normal lung vasculature.
synonyms: acyanotic CHD with normal pulmonary circulation

name: advanced bone age
description: Bone development progresses faster than chronological age.

name: advanced bone age in a newborn
description: Newborn exhibits accelerated skeletal development.

name: anomalous thoracic arterial communication
description: Abnormal connection between thoracic arteries.

name: anterior beaked vertebrae in a child
description: Abnormal bony protrusion of vertebrae in pediatric patients.

name: aortic arch anomaly
description: Abnormal configuration of the aortic arch.

name: ascites in an infant or child
description: Fluid accumulation in the abdominal cavity of a young patient.

name: basal cell carcinoma in children
description: Slow-growing skin cancer found in pediatric patients.

name: battered child syndrome
description: Injury pattern suggestive of repeated physical abuse.

name: bilateral enlargement of the mandible in a child
description: Symmetrical increase in size of the jawbone in pediatric patients.

name: bilateral pulmonary underaeration
description: Reduced air volume in both lungs.

name: brachydactyly
description: Condition where fingers or toes are abnormally short.

name: brain tumor in an infant
description: Neoplastic growth in the brain of a very young child.

name: bubbly lungs in infants and children
description: Air-filled cystic changes in the lungs of young patients.

name: cardiomegaly in childhood
description: Enlarged heart in a young patient.

name: cavitary lung lesion in an infant or child
description: Cavity or hollow space within the lung tissue of a young patient.

name: cerebellar mass in a child
description: Mass lesion in the cerebellum of a child.

name: choanal atresia
description: Congenital blockage of the nasal passage by tissue.

name: chronic aspiration pneumonia in a child
description: Recurrent pneumonia due to inhalation of food or liquid into the lungs.

name: clavicular lesion in an infant or child
description: Abnormal finding in the clavicle of a young patient.

name: cleft lip/palate
description: Congenital split or opening in the upper lip and/or roof of the mouth.

name: complete atrioventricular canal
description: Congenital heart defect with a large hole in the center of the heart.

name: complicated atrial shunt
description: Heart shunt with additional complications.

name: congenital abdominal calcifications
description: Presence of calcifications in the abdomen present from birth.

name: congenital abnormality of great toe
description: Birth defect affecting the great toe.

name: congenital absence of phalanx, digit, hand, or foot
description: Missing bones or digits in hand or foot from birth.

name: congenital atlantoaxial subluxation or instability
description: Abnormal motion at the junction of the first and second cervical vertebrae from birth.

name: congenital biliary tract abnormality
description: Birth defect affecting the bile ducts.

name: congenital brain malformation
description: Structural abnormalities in the brain present from birth.

name: congenital cardiomyopathy
description: Hereditary condition affecting heart muscle.

name: congenital coxa vara
description: Deformity of the hip where the angle formed by the head and shaft of the femur is reduced.

name: congenital craniovertebral junction abnormality
description: Anomaly at the base of skull and upper cervical spine present from birth.

name: congenital elbow anomaly
description: Birth defect affecting the elbow joint.

name: congenital foot deformity
description: Anomaly in foot structure present from birth.

name: congenital fused vertebrae
description: Two or more vertebrae fused together from birth.

name: congenital generalized osteoporosis
description: Decreased bone density throughout skeleton from birth.

name: congenital heart disease
description: A group of malformations of the heart and great vessels present from birth.

name: congenital heart disease with anterior right aortic arch
description: A congenital cardiovascular anomaly where the aortic arch takes a rightward course.

name: congenital heart disease with decreased pulmonary vascularity
description: A form of congenital heart defect characterized by reduced blood flow to the pulmonary vasculature.

name: congenital hepatomegaly
description: Enlargement of the liver present at birth.

name: congenital hydrocephalus
description: Excessive accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid in the brain present at birth causing ventricular dilation.

name: congenital hypodontia
description: Developmental absence of one or more teeth.

name: congenital intestinal malrotation
description: Abnormal rotation of the midgut during fetal development.

name: congenital joint subluxation
description: Partial dislocation of a joint from birth.

name: congenital lobar emphysema
description: Overinflation of a pulmonary lobe present at birth, leading to respiration difficulties.

name: congenital macrocephaly
description: Condition characterized by an unusually large head size present from birth.

name: congenital midface hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the midfacial region.

name: congenital narrow spinal canal
description: A narrower than normal spinal canal present from birth, potentially leading to nerve compression.

name: congenital pharyngeal abnormality
description: Abnormal development of the pharynx present at birth.

name: congenital posterior neural arch defect
description: Incomplete formation of the neural arch posterior elements of the spine.

name: congenital premature craniosynostosis
description: Premature fusion of one or more cranial sutures, affecting skull shape.

name: congenital prognathism
description: Forward positioning of the jaw present at birth.

name: congenital renal cystic disease
description: Formation of multiple cysts in the kidneys present from birth.

name: congenital renal or ureteral anomaly
description: Anomalies of the kidney or ureter present from birth.

name: congenital short hands and feet
description: Abnormally short hands and feet present from birth.

name: congenital short limbs
description: Unusually short limbs of a new-born, often indicating skeletal dysplasia.

name: congenital skull defect
description: A congenital anomaly in the structure of the skull, often characterized by abnormal gaps or defects.

name: congenital splenomegaly
description: An unusually large spleen present at birth, often due to congenital conditions.

name: congenital tracheal stenosis
description: A narrowing of the trachea present at birth leading to respiratory distress.

name: congenital vertebral abnormality
description: Congenital anomalies affecting spine vertebrae, can include conditions like hemivertebrae.

name: congenital widespread osteosclerosis
description: Diffuse increase in bone density present from birth, can affect various bones.

name: congenitally abnormal pelvis
description: Structural anomalies in the pelvis present at birth, may affect bone shape or symmetry.

name: congenitally abnormal scapula
description: Deformities or other anomalies in the scapula present from birth.

name: congenitally limited joint mobility
description: Restriction in joint movement present at birth, potentially due to joint or muscle anomalies.

name: craniotubular dysplasia
description: A group of disorders characterized by abnormal development of the cranium and tubular bones.

name: cranium bifidum
description: A congenital defect characterized by an opening in the cranial vault allowing herniation of brain tissues.

name: cyanotic congenital heart disease with increased pulmonary vascularity
description: A group of heart disorders present at birth causing cyanosis and increased pulmonary blood flow.

name: cyanotic congenital heart disease with precapillary hypertension vascularity
description: Congenital heart defects leading to cyanosis and elevated pressures in the pulmonary arteries before reaching the capillaries.

name: cystic abdominal mass in a fetus or newborn
description: Presence of a fluid-filled structure in the abdomen of a fetus or newborn, could be related to various structures.

name: decreased abdominal gas in a newborn
description: A radiological finding where the expected amount of gas in the infant's abdomen is reduced.

name: decreased cranial convolutional markings
description: Reduced visibility of the normal gyri patterns on imaging studies, often due to increased intracranial pressure.

name: defective pubic ossification
description: Abnormal development of the pubic bones seen on imaging, potentially due to congenital causes.

name: degenerative and metabolic disorders
description: A broad class of conditions involving deterioration of tissues or abnormal metabolic processing.

name: delayed bone age
description: A finding where x-rays show the bones appear younger than the patient’s chronological age.

name: delayed closure of fontanelles
description: The fontanelles remain open longer than normal in infants, can signify underlying conditions.

name: demyelinating disease
description: Diseases characterized by damage to the myelin sheath of the nervous system.

name: destructive nasopharyngeal mass in a child
description: Abnormal tissue growth in the nasopharynx causing destruction in children.

name: dextrocardia
description: Condition where the heart is located on the right side of the thorax.

name: dilated posterior urethra
description: Enlargement of the posterior part of the urethra.

name: disrupted epiphyseal-metaphyseal junction
description: Discontinuity at the growth plate area of bones.

name: distended gallbladder in a child
description: Enlarged gallbladder in a pediatric patient.

name: double bubble sign
description: Radiological sign indicating duodenal atresia or obstruction.

name: duplication of great toe
description: Presence of an extra great toe typically due to a congenital anomaly.

name: dysmyelinating disease
description: Disorders characterized by improper formation of the myelin sheath.

name: early femoral head ossification
description: Premature ossification of the femoral head.

name: eleven pairs of ribs
description: Presence of fewer than the normal 12 pairs of ribs.

name: esophageal lesion in a child
description: Abnormal mass or defect within the esophagus of a child.

name: familial neoplasm
description: Neoplasm occurring in a family context, suggesting genetic predisposition.

name: fetal cranial deformity
description: Abnormal shape or structure of the fetal skull observed via prenatal imaging.

name: fetal or neonatal liver calcification
description: Calcified deposits in the liver seen in fetuses or neonates.

name: gallstone or gallbladder sludge in a fetus or neonate
description: Solid deposits forming in the gallbladder of a fetus or neonate.

name: heart failure in childhood
description: Inability of the heart to pump adequately in a child.

name: heart failure in the first month of life
description: Inability of the heart to function properly in an infant's first month.

name: heart failure in the first week of life
description: Inability of the heart to function adequately in the neonatal period.

name: hepatosplenomegaly in a neonate
description: Enlargement of the liver and spleen in a newborn.

name: hyperdontia
description: Presence of extra teeth.

name: hypospadias or ambiguous external genitalia
description: An abnormality in the external genital structure or position, particularly seen in newborns and infants.

name: incomplete ossification of cranial sutures
description: Delayed ossification of the cranial sutures, normally present at birth or early infancy.

name: increased bone age
description: Advanced skeletal ossification compared to chronological age, often assessed by hand x-ray.

name: increased cranial convolutional markings
description: Prominent markings on the inner table of the skull bones, often in children.

name: increased prevertebral space in infants or children
description: Widening of the prevertebral soft tissue space, often indicating pathology like infection or hemorrhage.

name: increased risk of neoplasm
description: Increased likelihood of developing a neoplastic condition based on imaging findings or patient history.

name: infratentorial intracranial tumor in a child
description: Tumor located below the tentorium cerebelli, common in pediatric brain tumors.

name: inner ear anomaly
description: Congenital or acquired malformations of the inner ear structures.

name: intestinal obstruction in a child
description: Blockage in the intestine causing symptoms such as vomiting and abdominal pain.

name: intestinal obstruction in a newborn
description: Newborn presents with signs of intestinal blockage, often requiring urgent attention.

name: intracranial lesion in an infant
description: Any abnormal mass or lesion within the cranial cavity of an infant.

name: intraocular mass in a child
description: Presence of a mass within the eye, potentially indicating a neoplastic process.

name: juxtadiaphragmatic lesions in children
description: Lesions located near the diaphragm, potentially indicative of various conditions or masses.

name: large fontanelle
description: Enlarged soft spot on an infant's skull, potentially indicating hydrocephalus or other conditions.

name: large hands for age
description: Hands larger than expected for age, can be a clinical finding in certain syndromes.

name: large head in infant
description: Infant has a head size larger than the normal range for age, can indicate hydrocephalus or other conditions.

name: large vascular grooves of skull
description: Prominent grooves on the inner table of the skull, indicate expanded venous channels.

name: large ventricle in infant
description: Enlarged cerebral ventricles visible on imaging, potentially indicating hydrocephalus.

name: late onset of cyanosis in neonatal congenital heart disease
description: Delayed presentation of cyanosis in neonates with underlying congenital heart defects.

name: left-to-right shunt in congenital heart disease
description: Abnormal blood flow from left side to right side of heart due to congenital defects.

name: lethal skeletal dysplasia
description: A group of disorders characterized by severely abnormal bone growth, often incompatible with life.

name: localized wide epiphyseal plate
description: An abnormal widening of the growth plate in a localized region of the bone.

name: lower abdominal mass in a neonate or child
description: A palpable mass detected in the lower abdomen of a neonate or child.

name: marked cyanosis in first week of life
description: Significant bluish discoloration of the skin due to hypoxemia occurring in newborns.

name: meconium plug in newborn
description: Obstruction in the intestine of a newborn caused by thick, viscous meconium.

name: microcephaly
description: A condition where the head (circumference) is significantly smaller than expected.

name: microcolon
description: An abnormally small colon usually present from birth.

name: microcolon in newborn
description: Presence of a small colon detected in a newborn infant.

name: micrognathia
description: A condition where the jaw is smaller than normal.

name: middle ear anomaly
description: Abnormalities in the structure of the middle ear.

name: mild or intermittent cyanosis in first week
description: Transient or less severe bluish discoloration in newborns indicating potential hypoxia.

name: miliary lung opacities in a neonate or young infant
description: Diffuse small nodular opacities throughout the lungs, seen in infants.

name: multiple sclerotic foci in an infant or child
description: Presence of numerous dense, white spots within bones.

name: narrow pelvis in an infant or child
description: Abnormally small or narrow pelvic region for the age of the infant or child.

name: nasal ridge mass in a child
description: A mass located on the nasal bridge of a child.

name: neonatal renal mass
description: A mass in the kidney of a newborn detected through imaging.

name: neonatal respiratory distress
description: Difficulties in breathing experienced by a newborn baby.

name: nephroblastomatosis
description: A diffuse or multifocal overgrowth of embryonal kidney tissue, possibly a precursor to Wilms tumor.

name: nephrogenic rests
description: Clusters of embryonal cells within the kidney which may be precursors to Wilms tumor.

name: omphalocele
description: A congenital defect where abdominal organs herniate into the base of the umbilical cord.

name: ovarian neoplasm or cyst in a child
description: An abnormal growth or fluid-filled sac in the ovary of a child

name: pancreatic dysplasia
description: Abnormal development of pancreatic tissue

name: pancreatitis in a child
description: Inflammation of the pancreas in children

name: pediatric chest tumor
description: A mass or growth within the chest cavity of a child

name: pediatric chest wall lesion
description: An abnormality affecting the bony or soft tissue structures of the chest wall in a child

name: pelvic exostosis
description: A bony outgrowth from the surface of a bone in the pelvis

name: pelvic mass in an infant or child
description: An abnormal growth or lump in the pelvic area of a young child

name: perforated hollow viscus in an infant
description: A hole in the wall of a hollow organ, often causing pneumoperitoneum

name: periauricular pits
description: Small depression or pit near the external ear

name: periauricular tag
description: Small skin projection or nodule near the external ear

name: periosteal new bone formation in a child
description: Formation of new bone tissue along the periosteum in children, often reactive to insult

name: polyostotic bone lesions in an infant or young child
description: Multiple bone lesions affecting more than one bone

name: polyostotic bone lesions in children
description: Multiple lesions affecting several bones

name: posterior fossa tumor in a child
description: Tumor located in the posterior fossa part of the brain

name: premature epiphyseal fusion
description: Early closure of growth plates in bones leading to growth abnormalities

name: prominent periportal echoes in a neonate
description: Increased echogenicity around the portal veins in a newborn

name: renal mass in a child
description: An abnormal growth or tumor within the kidney in pediatrics

name: retarded skeletal maturation
description: Delayed bone age compared to chronological age

name: rib lesion in a child
description: Abnormality or lesion affecting one or more ribs in children

name: right-to-left atrial shunt
description: Abnormal blood flow from the right atrium directly to the left atrium

name: right-to-left shunt at ductus level
description: Abnormal blood flow from the right side of the heart to the left at the ductus arteriosus.

name: right-to-left shunt or admixture lesion in congenital heart disease
description: Presence of shunting or mixed blood flow in congenital heart anomalies.

name: right-to-left ventricular shunt
description: Shunting of blood from the right ventricle to the left.
synonyms: Right ventricular outflow tract obstruction with shunt

name: sacral agenesis or hypoplasia
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the sacrum.

name: scapular lesion in an infant or child
description: An abnormality in the scapula of a young patient.

name: separation of cranial sutures in a child
description: Increased spacing between cranial sutures.

name: shortened bone with premature growth-plate closure
description: Short bones due to early closure of growth plates.

name: small anterior fontanelle
description: Size of the anterior fontanelle is smaller than normal.

name: small sacroiliac notches
description: Narrowed notches at the sacroiliac joint.

name: small thymus in an infant
description: Underdeveloped thymus in a young child.

name: soft-tissue tumor in a child
description: Tumorous growth in soft tissues of a young patient.

name: solid liver lesion in an infant or young child
description: A solid mass found in the liver of a young patient.

name: solid liver lesion in an older child or adolescent
description: Solid mass in the liver of an older child.

name: spina bifida aperta
description: Type of spina bifida where the spinal cord is exposed through an opening.

name: spina bifida occulta
description: Mildest form of spina bifida characterized by a small gap in the spine.

name: supratentorial intracranial tumor in a child
description: A tumor located above the tentorium cerebelli in a child's brain.

name: testicular tumor in a child
description: Tumorous growth in the testicle of a child.

name: thirteen pairs of ribs
description: An anatomical variant where there is an extra pair of ribs.

name: thoracic dysplasia
description: Disorder of the development of the thoracic cage.

name: tracheal agenesis
description: Rare congenital condition where the trachea fails to develop.

name: tracheoesophageal fistula
description: An abnormal connection between the trachea and the esophagus.

name: type A pelvis
description: A classification of pelvis shape based on Caldwell-Moloy classification, often seen in anthropological or obstetric contexts.

name: type B pelvis
description: Another classification of pelvis shape in the Caldwell-Moloy system, sometimes used in obstetrics.

name: upper abdominal mass in a neonate or child
description: A detectable mass in the upper abdomen of a neonate or child, potentially indicative of various conditions.

name: upper airway obstruction in a child
description: Blockage or narrowing in the child's upper airway leading to respiratory difficulty.

name: urinary tract obstruction below the bladder in a child
description: Blockage in the urinary tract distal to the bladder, affecting urine flow in a child.

name: ventricular septal defect
description: A hole in the heart's ventricular septum, allowing blood to pass between the ventricles.

name: wide superior mediastinum in an infant or child
description: An abnormally broadening of the mediastinum in an infant or child, often indicative of underlying pathology.

name: Wilms tumor
description: A type of kidney cancer that primarily affects children.
